abstract.p: Interactive-media coalition formed by trade associations for agencies and advertisers has proposed standardizing advertisements for on-line media (S)

block.p: The interactive-media coalition formed by the trade associations for agencies and advertisers has proposed standardizing advertisements for on-line media.

The Coalition for Advertising Supported Information and Entertainment, known as Casie, said yesterday that its guidelines for standardization of the sizes and layouts of ad banners and so-called ad buttons would help reduce production costs, speed the creation of on-line ads and make ad-rate comparisons easier. Publishers that carry large amounts of advertising on the World Wide Web will be surveyed for opinions on the guidelines.
The interactive-media coalition formed by the trade associations for agencies and advertisers has proposed standardizing advertisements for on-line media.

The Coalition for Advertising Supported Information and Entertainment, known as Casie, said yesterday that its guidelines for standardization of the sizes and layouts of ad banners and so-called ad buttons would help reduce production costs, speed the creation of on-line ads and make ad-rate comparisons easier. Publishers that carry large amounts of advertising on the World Wide Web will be surveyed for opinions on the guidelines.

Several advertising and interactive agencies have been seeking common standards for on-line ads. Casie was formed in 1994 by the American Association of Advertising Agencies and the Association of National Advertisers.
